item.title: BM made Wireds 2010 Vaporware list
item.dc:creator: Douche
item.description:
Well guys it goes like this…

Valve did a crappy job of getting our hopes up when they “claimed” to have redone Half-Life source with the release of Half-Life 2. I think that disappointment is the reason this project even exists, it is a fan based effort to right the fact that Valve just rushed something through. Don’t troll the devs here, troll Valve for creating the demand for a better product!

I would release my own version if I had the time and the talent; I lack both and suspect many trolls here do too.

With that said, I have seen the recently (Sept2010) leaked screenshots and they looked amazing! The meticulous attention to detail along with the use of lighting effects will make this well worth the wait even if it doesn’t use the same engine as Crysis2 or whatever you guys want to compare it to. I don’t even play Crysis anymore but still play Half-Life so what does that say?

When I finally get to play Black Mesa for the first time, I don’t want to be blown away by the first 2 or 3 levels only to find out that the rest of the project was thrown together and pushed through.

I am glad the devs have stayed the course and allowed the pot to simmer slowly, they know that’s how you get the best texture and flavor out of the meat!

Yes the wait is painful (and we are all hungry) but if it produces a more complete and QUALITY release it will be worth it.

Nay sayers please try to understand.

Thanks for reading.

item.title: BM made Wireds 2010 Vaporware list
item.dc:creator: Givekidsmeth
item.description:
Grape Flavor:

No. No, I couldn’t disagree more. MechWarrior is a multiplayer mod. It’s expected to be imperfect and need balance and tweaks.

Black Mesa is all about recapturing the magic and wonder of experiencing Half-Life for the first time. Sure you could play it as a buggy, unfinished mess. And replay it successively as it got better. But by that time the novelty and mystery would be gone, never to return again. And constantly checking online to see if it’s good yet before you play would be spoiler hell.

When I play Black Mesa, I want a Valve level of polish and mastery to suck me in and immerse me in the game world.

Don’t release this thing until it’s done, and done right. I’m just concerned for when that day will come and if they’re on the right track.

Hence the need for betas. If you don’t like the concept of a beta, wait for the release. I deliberately didn’t read HLII articles in magazines before it came out to avoid any and all potential spoilers. But I’d prefer a beta of BMS in three months (that then gets polished with full community involvement via suggestion) over the full release either never happening or coming in two years.
